page.title: 12ALL SAINTS CHURCH TUDELEY
page.content: THIS CELEBRATED CHURCH WAS BUILT 800 YEARS AGO IN THE PARISH OF TUDELEY. IT STANDS ON THE SITE OF THE PREVIOUS CHURCH{NOTED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK.}THE CHURCH IS FAMOUS FOR ITS GLASS RATHER THAN ITS HISTORY.THERE ARE 8 BEAUTIFUL CONTEMPORARY{CHAGALL WINDOWS.}THE EAST WINDOW COMMEMORATES SARAH D'AVIGDOR GOLDSMID. IN THE CHANCEL STANDS THE {CANOPIED TOMB OF GEORGE FANE WHO DIED {1571 AND LIVED IN BADSELL MANOR. TWO {BRASSES DEPICT GEORGE'S GRANDPARENTS {THOMAS STIDULF AND HIS WIFE.}FOUR VICTORIAN APOSTLE WINDOWS IN THE CHANCEL ARE SOON TO BE REPLACED BY CHAGALL GLASS AND MOUNTED IN THE VESTRY.{THE CEILING OF THE NAVE IS {STRANGELY MARBLED.}THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE COME TO ADMIRE THE MARVELLOUS WINDOWS AND ENJOY THE TRANQUIL ATMOSPHERE OF OUR CHURCH WHICH IS LISTED IN{"THE {TREASURES OF BRITAIN".
